name: NH Amsterdam Centre

reviews.text: Great hotel. Classy, clean, in a great area. 10 min walk from the Dam square. Tram is just feet away. across the street from the hard rock and canal tour boats. 10-15 min from Van Gogh. Only downfall was the internet. We had issues getting online to check in for our flight. But other then that everyone there was very nice. Bellhops were great with bags, taxis, reservations. Nice hardwood floor rooms with comfy beds. I would stay here again! We paid about $140 a night on priceline. It is a 4-5 star hotel. Rooms are huge for european standards.
reviews.title: Great stay at the NH

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: On pulling up at the hotel we were geeted by the very friendly doorman who pointed out that bikes are allowed on certain parts of the pavement (good tip if you dont like broken bones). Check In was quick and staff helpful. Room was small but who stays in hoels rooms for anty long period of time. Breakfast expensive at 22 Euros but found the satalite sports bar great for breakfast at only 8.90 Euros. Great city plenty to do and some sights you will probably never see anywhere else.
reviews.title: Good Hotel Great Location
Christmas break
reviews.text: Booked through Superbreak and had 3 nights for 2 with breakfast included-exceptional value as hotel in excellent location, very clean and unfussy. staff very welcoming and happy to help. Room in front despite a nice view with mini balcony (romm 201) was small and bathroom cramped. Some rooms at back were bigger, smartly furnished. Plenty of eating options nearby. Perfect Christmas break. Get a good deal and this place is worth it. Try the canal hop on, hop off too- very good way of seeing amsterdam by day and night!
I have just returned from a 3 day, 2 night stay for a business trip. The place is NOT 5 *, and at best an average 4 *.
reviews.title: Very Average

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The place has a trendy feel to it and is more catered to the business traveller.
reviews.title: location +

reviews.text: My boyfriend and I, both in our mid-20's stayed in the Amsterdam Centre the first week in August. As a warning, there are many NH hotels in Amsterdam named similarly and we found ourselves at the incorrect hotel(NH City Centre) hotel at first. After seeing the unbelievably tiny rooms and feeling the heat from the broken A/C we promptly requested a transfer to the Amsterdam Centre.
reviews.title: Pleasant Stay, but very Pricey
Disappointing
reviews.text: The hotel was well kept, clean, and the staff had an overall friendly demeaner. While we found Amsterdam extremely expensive, this hotel was no exception. We ordered a coffee and a tea for breakfast one morning, recieved them 45 minutes later and were charged 8 euro(about 10 US dollars). Needless to say, we didn't eat breakfast at the hotel again. Also overpriced was the internet usage fee- 15 euro per day. We instead opted to use free internet cafes, which were plentiful around the city. We chose to pay a 25/euro a night fee to be upgraded, and it was worth it for a larger room on the side of the hotel(away from the noise of the trams and street traffic). The bed was extremely comfortable and a variety of pillows were available upon request.

The only complaint was an un-cooperative consierge, whom incorrectly informed us how to purchase a ticket for the Talis(the high-speed train to Paris). After first asking, he informed us it would be approximately 135 euro per person. He checked the prices, and said it was 250 per person. He then told us to buy internet usage to book the tickets ourselves. After we pleasantly asked him to book for us, he told us the tickets were sold out and we should go to the Central Station at once to try to get a ticket. An hour later, we arrived at Central Station to find an hour and a half wait to purchase tickets. We were very disgruntled. The next day, we inquired with another consierge. He promptly told us booking online was not possible, and he could arrange for a reservation so that we would not have to wait in the always long lines at the station. This trip for us was last minute, for we were not aware a 4 hour train ride would take us to Paris. If you have the chance, I would most definitely book this train for a wonderful trip.
reviews.title: Great Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: In general, we found Amsterdam food to consist of bread, cheese, french fries with mayo(at EVERY meal), and a fried-croquet type of dish. And of course, lots of beer. Be prepared to eat these odd dishes, or go hungry. We stopped at their grocery stores(Albert Heijn's), but could not decipher the labels on the food items.
reviews.title: Excellent Location - but choose your room!

reviews.text: Travel around the city is primarily by bike or tram. Tram cards can be purchased at the Albert Heijn's for a lower price than on the tram itself. Be aware of the bikes, for they don't yield for anything!
reviews.title: Good location beware building work means early start !!
Great location for foraging into the city centre!
reviews.text: We have returned from a wonderful Sat am to Sunday night quickie. Took a taxi from the airport at 35 euros saves all the hassle. They let us check in early but the superior room was overlooking an interior courtyard with scaffolding! A quick phone call later and we were given 2nd floor room overlooking the square which was only available later .No problem by the time we had returned our bags had been moved for us. Staff were excellent and the concierge brilliant at pointing us in the right direction. HIRE BIKES! just around the corner for 10 euros. There are great eating places around the hotel and dont miss the Bulldog coffee shop for some smoke ( 5mins way ).Although the Bulldog is touristy we loved the vibe and freindly crowd.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Took the Blue Boat Canal dinner cruise opposite the hotel for a 2 hour candle lit tour. Although the meal was pre-prepared it was really good and served by freindly staff with as much booze as you could drink! The location is great for cycling into the city and park. All in all a great weekend but HIRE BIKES to save blisters!
reviews.title: A fantasic stay - Would highly recommend!

reviews.text: I stayed in this hotel with my partner for 4 nights at the beginning of September. We had a brilliant time in Amsterdam - it's a wonderful city. We tried to fit in as much as possible and it was nice to come back to such a wonderful hotel to rest those aching feet!
reviews.title: Great Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: First impressions were great - the lobby was clean and modern with small but stylish bar, lounge area, resturants etc. Check-in was quick and our bags were taken up to the room.
reviews.title: Really tasty breakfast, frendly staff, very good location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We paid for a standard room, which as previous reviews have stated was a bit on the small side, but if you only use the room for sleeping then it's more than adequate. The room was clean and comfortable and offered dressing-gown, slippers etc. as well as tea/coffee facilities, mini-bar, safe, television (with English chnnels). The queen-size bed was extremely comfortable with choice of pillows. Could not hear any noise during the night and had really good night's sleep.
reviews.title: Terrific Hotel and Location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Great Hotel, great service, but do not use the internet in the hotel bedroom its a waste of space and time.
reviews.title: Above Average

reviews.text: Use internet outside the hotel it costs a lot less than in the hotel.
reviews.title: Perfectly Nice Hotel - Great Service

likes.liked: — Helpful and friendlt Staff. Nice large room

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I stayed for one night with a group of friends. E-mailed the hotel in advance with some specific requests and all were met. In fact when we checked in they advised that they had given us a free upgrade to a superior room.
reviews.title: 5 star I don't think so

reviews.text: Room was large and decorated in a very modern style and bathroom great, with all usual items you would expect from a hotel of this standard.
reviews.title: Doorman Makes The Difference!
Good location; pretty good room
reviews.text: Breakfast was great, with selection of cereal, fruit, cold meat, bacon, sausage, eggs, bread and pastries etc. etc. and is served till quite late in the morning. Good if you are nursing the after effects of a night sampling the delights Amsterdam.

description: The luxurious four-star NH Amsterdam Centre hotel is conveniently located in the heart of Amsterdam. at It is right across from the lively Leidse Square in the fashion and museum district, an area brimming with entertainment, dining and nightlife options. Amsterdam’s characteristic canals and the city’s top museums are just a short stroll from the hotel, as is the exclusive “PC Hooft” shopping street and the Vondelpark, a sprawling urban green space. The hotel is also within walking distance of the Heineken Brewery and the world famous Rijksmuseum, featuring a slew of Dutch masterpieces, including Rembrandt's "The Night Watch". The Museumsquare, home to several museums including the Van Gogh Museum, is just a ten-minute walk away from the NH Amsterdam Centre.
